concept.title: Recovery
concept.shortdesc: JDBC Consumer supports recovery after a deliberate or unexpected stop when it performs incremental queries. Recovery is not supported for full queries.

conbody.p: JDBC Consumer originrecoveryrecoveryJDBC ConsumerIn incremental mode, JDBC Consumer uses offset values in the offset column to determine where to continue processing after a deliberate or unexpected stop. To ensure seamless recovery in incremental mode, use a primary key or indexed column as the offset column. As JDBC Consumer processes data, it tracks the offset value internally. When the pipeline stops, JDBC Consumer notes where it stopped processing data. When you restart the pipeline, it continues from the last-saved offset.
When JDBC Consumer performs full queries, the origin runs the full query again after you restart the pipeline.
